questions.question: If you see side-by-side red lights flashing at a railroad crossing, you must:
options: Signal before going any further
Maintain your speed and cross the railroad
Slow down
Stop
questions.answer: Stop

questions.question: When driving in foggy weather, which headlights should you use?
options: High beam headlights
Low beam headlights
Hazard lights
Parking lights
questions.answer: Low beam headlights

questions.question: According to Washington's child restraint law, when can a child move from a booster seat to using a seat belt alone?
options: At 6 years of age
At 8 years of age or when 4’9” tall
At 10 years of age
At 12 years of age
questions.answer: At 8 years of age or when 4’9” tall

questions.question: What does an 'End school zone' sign indicate?
options: That the speed limit is 20 mph
The beginning of a reduced speed zone
The increased possibility of encountering pedestrians
The end of a reduced speed zone
questions.answer: The end of a reduced speed zone

questions.question: On a freeway, when you see a 'Merging traffic' sign, you should:
options: Honk at incoming traffic
Maintain your present speed
Speed up to avoid congesting traffic
Move to another lane, if safe, to let traffic enter
questions.answer: Move to another lane, if safe, to let traffic enter

questions.question: If two drivers arrive at an open intersection at the same time, who has the right-of-way?
options: The driver on the right
The driver on the left
The driver who is larger
The driver who honks first
questions.answer: The driver on the right

questions.question: If your brakes fail while driving, what should you do first?
options: Immediately pull off the road
Pump the brake pedal several times to build pressure
Accelerate to gain control
Turn off the engine immediately
questions.answer: Pump the brake pedal several times to build pressure

questions.question: What is the legal speed limit in Washington school zones under normal conditions?
options: 15 mph
20 mph
25 mph
30 mph
questions.answer: 20 mph

questions.question: At a railroad crossing with a crossbuck sign and flashing red lights, you must:
options: Stop and wait until it is safe
Slow down and cross quickly
Honk to alert the train
Continue driving at the same speed
questions.answer: Stop and wait until it is safe

questions.question: If you are impaired and refuse to take a breath test during a DUI stop, what is the minimum license suspension period for a first offense?
options: 30 days
90 days
One year
Two years
questions.answer: 90 days

questions.question: Before changing lanes, a driver should:
options: Check the rearview mirror only
Use turn signals and check both mirrors and blind spots
Immediately change lanes without checking
Honk to alert approaching vehicles
questions.answer: Use turn signals and check both mirrors and blind spots

questions.question: When driving in rainy conditions, you should:
options: Increase your speed to avoid puddles
Maintain the same speed as on dry roads
Reduce your speed, as traction is decreased
Only turn on your high beams
questions.answer: Reduce your speed, as traction is decreased

questions.question: The Four-Second Following Distance Rule helps you:
options: Follow too closely to improve fuel economy
Gauge a safe distance by counting the seconds until you pass a fixed object
Know when to overtake slower vehicles
Estimate your travel time on highways
questions.answer: Gauge a safe distance by counting the seconds until you pass a fixed object

questions.question: When backing up your vehicle safely, you should:
options: Rely solely on your rearview mirror
Turn and look directly through the rear window
Only check your side mirrors
Back up quickly without stopping
questions.answer: Turn and look directly through the rear window

questions.question: If your vehicle begins to hydroplane on a wet road, you should:
options: Brake hard immediately
Ease off the gas pedal and steer straight
Accelerate to regain traction
Turn sharply to correct the skid
questions.answer: Ease off the gas pedal and steer straight

questions.question: When approaching a railroad crossing with flashing red lights and a crossing gate, you must:
options: Slow down and proceed with caution
Stop and wait until the lights stop flashing and the gate is raised
Honk to alert the train
Speed up to cross before the train arrives
questions.answer: Stop and wait until the lights stop flashing and the gate is raised

questions.question: Which of the following actions is NOT recommended to minimize distracted driving?
options: Keeping your phone out of reach while driving
Avoiding eating or using personal devices while driving
Using hands-free devices extensively as a substitute for safe driving
Pulling over safely if you need to use an electronic device
questions.answer: Using hands-free devices extensively as a substitute for safe driving

questions.question: If you are being tailgated, the safest course of action is to:
options: Speed up to put distance between you and the tailgater
Brake abruptly to warn the driver
Move to the right lane to allow the tailgater to pass
Honk continuously until the tailgater backs off
questions.answer: Move to the right lane to allow the tailgater to pass

questions.question: When following an emergency vehicle such as a fire truck, you must:
options: Follow closely to keep pace with traffic
Maintain a distance of at least 500 feet
Speed up to stay in your lane
Move to the left to allow room for passing
questions.answer: Maintain a distance of at least 500 feet

questions.question: When making a right turn at night, to avoid being blinded by oncoming headlights you should:
options: Turn on your high beams
Look away from the headlights toward the right side of the road
Flash your headlights at the oncoming vehicle
Slow down significantly
questions.answer: Look away from the headlights toward the right side of the road

questions.question: When merging onto a highway, the safest method is to:
options: Stop at the end of the ramp and wait
Merge slowly after accelerating to match the speed of traffic
Enter the highway at a much lower speed than traffic
Honk to clear the lane before merging
questions.answer: Merge slowly after accelerating to match the speed of traffic

questions.question: A 'No Passing Zone' sign indicates that:
options: Passing is allowed only on the right
Passing is prohibited in that area
You may pass after slowing down
Only light vehicles may pass
questions.answer: Passing is prohibited in that area

questions.question: A flashing yellow traffic light means that you should:
options: Stop immediately
Proceed with caution
Treat it as a red light
Accelerate to clear the intersection
questions.answer: Proceed with caution

questions.question: When approaching a school bus with its red lights flashing, you must:
options: Slow down and pass on the right
Stop regardless of your direction of travel
Proceed if no children are visible
Honk to alert the bus driver
questions.answer: Stop regardless of your direction of travel

questions.question: When parallel parking, you should aim to park within:
options: 24 inches of the curb
18 inches of the curb
12 inches of the curb
6 inches of the curb
questions.answer: 12 inches of the curb

questions.question: The primary function of an ignition interlock device is to:
options: Allow a driver to operate a vehicle without a breath test
Prevent the vehicle from starting if the driver’s BAC exceeds a preset limit
Record a driver’s alcohol consumption for later review
Be used as a substitute for a driver’s license renewal test
questions.answer: Prevent the vehicle from starting if the driver’s BAC exceeds a preset limit

questions.question: Under the 'Implied Consent Law', if you refuse a breath test during a DUI stop, you will face:
options: A warning with no further consequences
License suspension for at least one year
A minor fine only
An immediate arrest without license suspension
questions.answer: License suspension for at least one year

questions.question: Which of the following is considered dangerously distracted driving?
options: Using a voice-operated GPS system while driving
Eating or drinking while driving
Listening to the radio at moderate volume
Talking briefly with a passenger
questions.answer: Eating or drinking while driving

questions.question: If you are involved in a minor collision with a parked vehicle, you should:
options: Leave the scene immediately to avoid traffic delays
Try to locate the owner and leave a note with your contact information
Call 911 and wait for the police to arrive
Argue with any nearby witnesses
questions.answer: Try to locate the owner and leave a note with your contact information

questions.question: If you see a vehicle on the road with an unsecured load, you should:
options: Quickly pass the vehicle without changing lanes
Maintain a safe distance and report the situation to 911 if it is safe to do so
Honk to alert the driver
Ignore it as it is not your responsibility
questions.answer: Maintain a safe distance and report the situation to 911 if it is safe to do so
